mention.text: LOS ANGELES -- A much-awaited report that paints a distressing picture of brutality and racism in the Los Angeles Police Department , and that calls for the resignation of its chief
A much-awaited report that paints a distressing picture of brutality and racism in the Los Angeles Police Department , and that calls for the resignation of its chief
a distressing picture of brutality and racism in the Los Angeles Police Department
brutality and racism in the Los Angeles Police Department
a commission appointed by Mayor Tom Bradley and Police Chief Daryl Gates in the wake of the videotaped beating March 3 of a black motorist , Rodney King , by Los Angeles police
the department that have come to light
the chief , who has remained steadfast through repeated calls from community leaders for his ouster
Nearly one-quarter of 650 officers responding to a commission survey
officers who violate the rules governing excessive force
no effort to monitor or control these messages , evidence of a `` significant breakdown in the department 's management responsibility
a must-read for police chiefs around the country
the `` community-based '' policing style that encourages officers to spend less time in their cars and more time interacting with citizens in the communities they serve
citizens in the communities they serve
a Washington , D.C. , law enforcement research group
a 1970s blue-ribbon study that exposed widespread corruption in the New York Police Department and led to significant improvements there
vice chairman of the 10-member Independent Commission on the Los Angeles Police Department
the commission 's recommendations are : -- A commission appointed by the mayor that oversees
A `` major overhaul '' of the police disciplinary system and the process used by citizens to file complaints against LAPD officers , especially in excessive force cases
the city still sharply divided over the future of Chief Gates
the City Council , which will weigh whether to adopt them in whole or in part
